activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#9122
activity.text:
> > [@Jacobjeevan](https://github.com/Jacobjeevan) [@nihal467](https://github.com/nihal467) I found the issue of total count on card ,the problem is the logic only counts from data fetched from current page .Need a bit of help ,I have a doubt/confusion on how to approach ,so should i fetch the entire data of all pages at once i.e change limit and offset?Or do i have to write an api for that or is there any other way ?
> > ![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/3fa61f92-0889-433d-b94b-fb4528d21acd)
> > ![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/28c10f9e-719d-4eba-8ff1-60d583ac8ef2)
> 
> Hmm ðŸ¤” Easiest way would probably be to tweak the api rather than fetching all the results; that would affect pagination unless you want to call the api twice.
> 
> In this case, modifying HospitalDoctorViewSet to return the total along with the results should work.

Will give it a try and let u know if it works.Thanks for the help sir.

activity.title: ohcnetwork/leaderboard#546
activity.text:
> Hey @PAVAN507-STAR
> 
> Although your PR does achieve the functionallity almost right without using Jotai, using Jotai (as hinted in issue) was a much more cleaner approach as you wouldn't have to manually write useEffects to handle initial state and call localStorage methods to read or write to it. With `useAtom` you could simply use it like a `useState` and the state be synced with local storage by Jotai.

Okay cool,will improve in further contributions.I asked for assign in couple of issues .can u check and tell if it's possible for u to assign me those issues?
